The Divine Maiden’s Mansion of the One Who Gave the Best Cloth
“I sang a song of seven strings,
so sweet and delightful,
and he invited me to the stage,
‘Be my refuge, O Kosiya!’
“I was his refuge,
I was the one who worshipped the teacher.
The disciple will not defeat him,
the teacher will defeat the disciple.”
“With your surpassing beauty,
you stand there, divine one,
shining in all directions,
like a medicinal herb, a star.
By what is your beauty like this?
By what do you shine here?
And how do you get the wealth
that is dear to the mind?
I ask you, divine one of great influence,
what merit did you make as a human being?
By what are you so radiant?

translated: Your beauty shines in all directions.”

“The woman who gives the best of cloths
is the best of women among men;
So the one who gives what is dear and beautiful
after death obtains a heavenly place.
See my mansion,
I am a celestial nymph, beautiful in form.
I am the best of a thousand celestial nymphs—
see the result of merit.
Because of that I have such a form,
because of that I shine here;
And my wealth increases,
all that my mind desires.
I tell you, monk of great power,
when I was a human I did a twin deed of merit;
Because of that I have such radiant splendor,
